db:article.db:para: Compiles Qt Linguist .ts files into .qm files.
The command is defined in the LinguistTools component of the Qt6 package. Load the package with:

db:warning.db:para: This function is deprecated. Consider using the target-based functions qt6_add_lrelease or qt6_add_translations instead.

db:section.db:title: Synopsis
db:section.db:para: If versionless commands are disabled, use qt6_add_translation instead. It supports the same set of arguments as this command.

db:section.db:title: Description
db:section.db:para: Calls lrelease on each .ts file passed as an argument, generating .qm files. The paths of the generated files are added to <VAR>.

db:section.db:title: Options
db:section.db:para: You can set additional OPTIONS that should be passed when lrelease is invoked. You can find possible options in the lrelease documentation.
By default, the qm files will be placed in the current build directory (CMAKE_CURRENT_BINARY_DIR). To change this, you can set OUTPUT_LOCATION as a property of the source .ts file.
For example, with the following code, the .qm files are generated in a translations directory below the current build directory.

db:section.db:title: Examples
db:section.db:para: Generating helloworld_en.qm, helloworld_de.qm in the build directory:
Generating helloworld_en.qm, helloworld_de.qm in a l10n sub-directory:
db:section.db:programlisting: set(TS_FILES helloworld_en.ts helloworld_de.ts) set_source_files_properties(${TS_FILES} PROPERTIES OUTPUT_LOCATION "l10n") qt_add_translation(qmFiles ${TS_FILES})
